description: Curated Gap A/B/C patterns - Hand-selected for Gemini 2.5 Pro semantic analysis
curator: Manual semantic analysis via Gemini 2.5 Pro

gap_a_emotion_action.description: Emotion + Action patterns requiring sentence surgery (≤3 JP sentences)

dialogue.jp: 「……真樹、大丈夫？　私がいなくて、寂しくなって泣いちゃいたりしない？」
dialogue.surgery_note: The trailing emotion + action creates a rhetorical question - preserve teasing tone

dialogue.jp: 「真樹、落ち込む前に、とにかく自分の名前見つけよ。まだ先生たちのミスで名前が入ってない可能性もあるし」
dialogue.surgery_note: Emotion acknowledged then redirected to action - keep the pivot structure
Stuttering + denial + trailing off = classic tsundere - preserve hesitation markers

narrative.jp: 親友と離れ離れになり、初めのうちは落ち込んでいた天海さんだったものの、持ち前の切り替えの早さで、いつもの溌溂とした笑顔を取り戻している。
narrative.surgery_note: Contrast structure (A→B) - preserve the pivot with 'ものの'

narrative.jp: 学年トップ５に入る成績の海と違って当落線上にいたので、もちろんこうなることも覚悟の上ではあったけれど……とはいえ、実際に自分の名前がないことを確認すると、さすがに落ち込みはするわけで。
narrative.surgery_note: Layered hedging (覚悟の上/とはいえ/さすがに) - each layer adds nuance

narrative.jp: 同時に、それまでは感じなかった言いようのない緊張がどっと押し寄せてきた。
narrative.surgery_note: Physical metaphor for emotion - どっと conveys overwhelming force

action_pairs.泣: crying action - often paired with sad/lonely

gap_b_ruby_jokes.description: Ruby visual jokes requiring preservation or TL notes

kira_kira_names.description: Outlandish kanji with unexpected readings (DQN names)
kira_kira_names.note: Kira-kira names use katakana readings or creative kanji-reading mismatches

examples.en_approach: TL note: 'Pikachu' - written with kanji meaning 'light' and 'space'
Could use 'Love' as name with note about kanji

detection_patterns: Katakana ruby on kanji names (most common indicator)
Commentary about modern naming trends (キラキラネーム)

Royalty: プリンセス, キング, クイーン, プリンス
Celestial: スター, ムーン, サン, スカイ
Nature: オーシャン, フラワー, スノー

Precious: ダイヤ, ルビー, パール, ジュエル
Angels: エンジェル, セラフ, ヘブンリー

archaic_readings.treatment: Standard translation - ruby is for Japanese readers' convenience

deliberate_misreadings.description: Kanji with intentionally wrong furigana for humor/effect

examples.context: When 'world' is read as 'these guys' to show character's worldview
examples.en_approach: Use italics or <small> for the ironic reading

double_meaning_ruby.description: Ruby that adds subtext/irony to the base kanji

gap_c_sarcasm_subtext.description: Sarcasm and subtext patterns requiring creative translation

TSUNDERE.description: Denies feelings while showing them through actions
markers: そんなわけない (That's not true at all)
Stuttering: あ、あの / ち、ちがう

curated_examples.context_before: 「あ、いまちょっとドキッとしたでしょ？」
curated_examples.context_after: 「え～？　ウソウソ、強がりはよくないな～？」
curated_examples.subtext: Obviously did feel something, embarrassed to admit
curated_examples.translation_approach: Preserve stutter, preserve trailing off, let denial ring hollow

curated_examples.jp: 「べ、別にあんたのためじゃないんだからね！」
curated_examples.subtext: Absolutely is for them, classic tsundere deflection
curated_examples.translation_approach: Keep stutter, 'It's not like I did it for YOU or anything!' - italics on 'you'

KUUDERE.description: Emotionally flat delivery hiding deeper feelings

curated_examples.subtext: Processing intense emotions behind flat exterior
curated_examples.translation_approach: 'I see.' - Period, no elaboration, let reader infer

curated_examples.jp: そんなの、誰がどう見ても可愛いに決まっているのだ。
curated_examples.translation_approach: Obviously she's cute—anyone with eyes could see that.

IRONIC_SELF_DEPRECATION.description: Putting oneself down while actually criticizing others/situation

curated_examples.jp: 「いや、私みたいなのがいたら、絶対盛り下がるし」
curated_examples.context: Refusing to participate in class event
curated_examples.subtext: Testing whether others will contradict, also genuinely self-aware
curated_examples.translation_approach: Keep the self-aware edge: 'Having someone like me around would just kill the mood anyway.'

tsundere_patterns: 別に.{0,20}(ない|ねー|ねぇ)(けど|が|でも|わけ)?
誰が.{0,20}(なんて|って)(言った|思った)?

gap_a_surgery.when_to_apply: JP sentences with emotion+action where ≤3 sentences but EN requires restructuring
gap_a_surgery.gemini_prompt_template: Analyze this Japanese passage for emotion-action pairing. If restructuring improves English flow while preserving the emotional beat, suggest surgery. Temperature 0.4 for conservative changes.
gap_a_surgery.safety_check: Never apply to passages >3 JP sentences without explicit human approval

gap_b_ruby.when_to_apply: All ruby annotations during EPUB processing
classification_flow: 1. Check if kira-kira name (unusual reading for common kanji)
2. Check if archaic reading (standard - no special treatment)
gap_b_ruby.gemini_prompt_template: Classify this ruby annotation: kanji={kanji}, ruby={ruby}, context={context}. Return category and suggested EN treatment.

gap_c_subtext.when_to_apply: Dialogue lines matching sarcasm detection patterns
gap_c_subtext.gemini_prompt_template: Analyze this dialogue for subtext. Speaker archetype hints: {markers_found}. What is the character actually feeling vs saying? Temperature 1.0 for creative interpretation.
gap_c_subtext.confidence_filter: Only surface to human review if confidence ≥0.85
